sen.j: 豊島 時光（としま ときみつ、生没年不詳）は鎌倉時代の武士。
sen.e: Tokimitsu TOSHIMA, whose dates of birth and death were unknown, was a samurai during the Kamakura period.
Tokimitsu TOSHIMA (year of birth and death unknown) was a samurai during the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 生没年不詳を（ ）でくくりました。datesをyearと書き換えました。
sen.e: Tokimitsu TOSHIMA (year of birth and death unknown) was a samurai during the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 父は豊島朝経（または豊島朝綱）。
sen.e: His father was Tomotsune, or Tomotsuna, TOSHIMA.
His father was Tomotsune TOSHIMA or Tomotsuna TOSHIMA.
sen.cmt: 両方に名字をつけました。
sen.e: His father was Tomotsune TOSHIMA or Tomotsuna TOSHIMA.
Tokimitsu was commonly known as Matataro.

sen.j: 豊島氏は鎌倉幕府創業の功臣で、南武蔵国（東京都周辺）に所領を持っていた。
sen.e: A meritorious vassal in the formation of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), the Toshima clan had its territory in the Musashi province, now around Tokyo.
The Toshima clan was a meritorious vassal in the formation of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and had its territory in Musashi province, now around Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 語順を入れ替え、書き換えました。国名の前の定冠詞を削除しました。以下同様。
sen.e: The Toshima clan was a meritorious vassal in the formation of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and had its territory in Musashi province, now around Tokyo.

sen.j: 時光と大宮盛員（武蔵国の御家人）が武蔵国豊島庄犬食名を巡って争論した。
sen.e: Tokimitsu and Morikazu OMIYA, gokenin (immediate vassal of the shogunate) in the Musashi province, disputed over a land of Toshima, Musashi..
sen.cmt: ※「庄犬食名」の訳は不明のため、意訳しました。
sen.e: Tokimitsu and Morikazu OMIYA (gokenin [immediate vassal of the shogunate] in Musashi province) disputed over a land of Toshima clan in Musashi Province.
sen.cmt: 大宮盛員（武蔵国の御家人）を書き換えました。ピリオドを１つにしました。武蔵国にprovinceを加えました。豊島庄は豊島氏の私領と思われ、犬食名はその名前だと思われますが、大食の書き間違いだ等諸説あり、ここでは単にlandとしました。
sen.e: Tokimitsu and Morikazu OMIYA (gokenin [immediate vassal of the shogunate] in Musashi province) disputed over a land of Toshima clan in Musashi Province.

sen.j: 原因は大宮有忠が胴元となった四一半（サイコロを用いた丁半賭博のようなもの）にあった。
sen.e: This was caused by shiichi-han (type of chohan tobaku, or gambling at a game of dice) whose bookmaker was Aritada OMIYA.
This was caused by shiichi-han (type of chohan tobaku, or gambling at a game of dice) whose bookmaker was Aritada OMIYA.
This was caused by shiichi-han (type of chohan tobaku, or gambling at a game of dice) whose bookmaker was Aritada OMIYA.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代には御家人による双六や四一半による博打が盛んで、中には屋敷や所領まで賭ける者がいて、勝敗がもとで殺し合いにまでなり、社会問題となっていた。
sen.e: In the Kamakura period, gambling games of sugoroku and shiichi-han were popular among gokenin, with some gambling even their residence or territory on wins and losses, which sometimes resulted in a killing fight, thus being a social problem.

In the Kamakura period, gambling games of sugoroku and shiichi-han were popular among gokenin, and some of them even risked their residence or territory, which sometimes resulted in a killing fight, and became a social problem.
sen.cmt: 簡潔に書き換えました。
sen.e: In the Kamakura period, gambling games of sugoroku and shiichi-han were popular among gokenin, and some of them even risked their residence or territory, which sometimes resulted in a killing fight, and became a social problem.

sen.j: 幕府は御成敗式目の追加法で幾度も博打の禁令を出しており、違背すれば召し放ちにすると定めていた。
sen.e: The bakufu enacted bans on gambling a number of times in amendments to Goseibai-shikimoku (code of conduct for samurai), stipulating that one should be dismissed if in breach.
The bakufu enacted bans on gambling a number of times in amendments to Goseibai-shikimoku (code of conduct for samurai), stipulating that people who violated the bans should be dismissed.
sen.cmt: breachをviolateにし、if inの部分を書き換えました。
sen.e: The bakufu enacted bans on gambling a number of times in amendments to Goseibai-shikimoku (code of conduct for samurai), stipulating that people who violated the bans should be dismissed.

sen.j: 時光と大宮盛員の双方が幕府に訴えを出した。
sen.e: Both Tokimitsu and Morikazu OMIYA made appeals to the bakufu.
Both Tokimitsu and Morikazu OMIYA made appeals to the bakufu.
Both Tokimitsu and Morikazu OMIYA made appeals to the bakufu.

sen.j: 豊島庄犬食名は豊島氏の所領であり、正確な場所は不明だが、足立区堀之内、川口市南平柳、荒川区尾久あたりと推定される。
sen.e: The disputed land of Toshima was part of the territory of the Toshima clan, whose location has not been specified but is presumed to have been around Horinouchi, Adachi Ward, Minami-hirayamagi, Kawaguchi City, or Oku, Arakawa Ward.
sen.cmt: ※「庄犬食名」の訳は不明のため、意訳しました。
sen.e: The disputed land of Toshima was part of the territory of the Toshima clan, whose location has not been specified but is presumed to have been around Horinouchi, Adachi Ward, Minami-hirayamagi, Kawaguchi City, or Oku, Arakawa Ward.

The disputed land of Toshima was part of the territory of the Toshima clan, whose location has not been specified but is presumed to have been around Horinouchi, Adachi Ward, Minami-hirayamagi, Kawaguchi City, or Oku, Arakawa Ward.

sen.j: 仁治2年（1241年）4月25日、対馬仲康が奉行となり裁決を下し、豊島庄犬食名は没収されてしまった。
sen.e: On April 25, 1241, Nakayasu TSUSHIMA issued a ruling as a bugyo (magistrate), thus confiscating Toshima's land.
sen.cmt: ※「庄犬食名」の訳は不明のため、意訳しました。
sen.e: On June 30 1241, Nakayasu TSUSHIMA issued a ruling as a bugyo (magistrate), thus Toshima's land was confiscated.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を新暦に変換し、没収された部分を書き換えました。
sen.e: On June 30 1241, Nakayasu TSUSHIMA issued a ruling as a bugyo (magistrate), thus Toshima's land was confiscated.

sen.j: 時光の父の朝経は土佐国守護、祖父の豊島有経は紀伊国守護を務めて豊島氏が土佐や紀伊へ進出して水運業を営んでいた形跡がある。
sen.e: According to some record, the Toshima clan set up a business of water transport in the Tosa and Kii provinces, in which Tokimitsu's father Tomotsune and his grand-father Aritsune TOSHIMA was the governor, respectively.

According to some records, the Toshima clan set up a business of water transport in Tosa and Kii provinces where Tokimitsu's father Tomotsune and his grand-father Aritsune TOSHIMA were governors, respectively.
sen.cmt: 数の変更をしました。国名の定冠詞を削除しました。
sen.e: According to some records, the Toshima clan set up a business of water transport in Tosa and Kii provinces where Tokimitsu's father Tomotsune and his grand-father Aritsune TOSHIMA were governors, respectively.

sen.j: そのため、この事件は単純な丁半博打ではなく、水運業者の時光が所領を投機の対象にしていたのではないかという説もある。
sen.e: Therefore, some theories suggest that this incident was not a mere gambling but that Tokimitsu, involved in the water transport business, gambling his territory.
Therefore, some theories suggest that this affair was not a mere gambling but that Tokimitsu who involved in the water transport business gambled his territory.
